Kakkatarasadāyaka：The story of a farmer in Magadhakhetta，who gave a meal consisting of broth made of crab to a monk suffering from earache，and cured him．The farmer was born after death in a palace in Tāvatimsa．At the entrance to the palace was the figure of a ten-clawed crab，finished in gold．Vv．54； VvA．243ff．
